title: Large-Scale Inquiry-Based Genetic Modeling: Understanding Molecular-Cellular-Genotypic-Phenotypic Connections

context.prior_knowledge: Basic life science concepts (cell structure, DNA structure) and high school-level genetics knowledge
context.additional_context: Some educational participants are completing teaching credentials, while others are prospective graduates preparing for careers in life sciences.

learning_goals: Constructing a schema that integrates the three tiers of genetic models (inheritance, meiosis, and molecular mechanisms)

Using virtual lab tools (e.g., Punnett Square Simulator, Hardy-Weinberg Calculator), learners can analyze five or more genetic phenomena (e.g., Mendelian inheritance, incomplete dominance, codominance) and derive predictive results with over 90% accuracy through Punnett squares and gene frequency calculations.

Learners can simulate gene expression mechanisms (promoter, transcription, translation) using digital modeling tools (e.g., CellDesigner, COPASI) and write reports explaining the gene-editing principles of the CRISPR-Cas9 system linked to three or more real-world applications (e.g., gene therapy, crop improvement).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
